This hotel has not been renovated in quite some time and it shows.  All things considered, I would gladly stay here again!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the review you posted about your recent stay with us and for the nice words about our front desk staff!! I have passed on your comments to the General Manager, who has made sure that our staff sees them.   As I have mentioned in past replies, we are so lucky to be in the location we are in and to be in such close walking distance to the Disney Parks, as well as being surrounded by so many wonderful eating establishments.   Thank you again for your review! We look forward to you staying with us again!  The Castle Inn & Suite Management

Summary Heading: Great place for price! Nice place.
Summary: This place exceeded our expectations.  We stayed for our spring break Disneyland trip. Property was clean.  We stayed in a family suite.  Clean floors, walls, bedding, towels and bathroom.  2 large tv's.  Plenty of storage space.  Micro and fridge and coffee maker.   We were in room 459. Plenty of towels.  Hair dryer in bathroom. A no frills hotel at a great rate for a family of 5. Approximately a 5 minute walk to DLR.  No shuttles offered since it is so close to the park. The suite had 3 queen beds.  Front room had 1 of the beds, fridge, micro and coffee maker and small table with 2 chairs.   Large bathroom and closet in between both rooms.  Bedroom had sink, towels and vanity with chair along with 2 queen rooms and lots of moving around space. No parking fees either!! Last
Manager Response: Thank you, thank you, thank you for the wonderful review of your stay with us earlier this month. We are so pleased to hear that we "exceeded your expectations" and that everything met with your approval.  It is our privilege to pass on complimentary parking for one car, per room, to our guests as we are aware that this is often part of the decision making process when choosing a place to stay.   Thank you again! We appreciate your time and hope that you will stay with us another time in the future.  Regards,  The Castle Inn & Suites Management

Summary Heading: No frills, cheap thrills, nice place to crash!
Summary: We stayed at the Castle Inn and suites for the first time on Feb 25th 2012.  As regulars to Disneyland we are always looking for a reasonable priced, clean hotel. This place was just fine with us.  The room was very clean.  We were on the 4th floor, so it was quiet.  In the morning the kids were out and running, but we expect that around Disneyland.  We have stayed at several other hotels in the area, and we will be back here to stay again.  Its only about a 5 minute walk to Disney.  No charge for parking is a plus!  The room was large, had a fridge, coffee maker, and hair dryer.  The only downside is no breakfast, but we usually bring a few snacks anyway. The pool looked rather small, but we never use them anyway.  If you looking for a place to stay that is clean and
Manager Response: We wanted to thank you for the time you took to comment about your stay last month at the Castle Inn & Suites! We are pleased that you enjoyed your visit and that you will be back another time!  Our location, having a short walk to the Disney Parks and the fact that we offer free parking to our guests are definitely added bonuses.   Thank you again for your time!  The Castle Inn & Suites Management

Summary: We stayed o/n at this hotel while on a two-day family vacation at disneyland.For a family of 6 on a budget, this hotel exceeded our expectations. It was walking distance of the park, clean, and affordable. We were upgraded to a two room at no extra cost, and had fridge, microwave, 2 tvs, and extra towels and blankets. We were also able to park our car there free of charge for both of the two days which saved us an extra $30 of parking fees.We were very impressed and definately would use this hotel again!
Manager Response: Thank you very much for the comments regarding your stay with us last month. We are thrilled that you and your family enjoyed your vacation and that the upgrade was a great surprise for you!   We are happy to offer complimentary parking to our guests and are glad that you used it to your advantage!  Thank you for the time it took for you to post on TripAdvisor! We look forward to seeing again in the future!  The Castle Inn & Suites Management

Summary: I was looking for a room to stay in I was surpising the kids with a weekend at disneyland & called every hotel around the park all the hotels were booked. I went on line seen this hotel was down the street but only had a room for saturday i called spoke to a lady & asked if any room for friday and saturday she said she had one left it was a family suite.. i said i'll take it! this room was so big there was lots of room and it was clean ... it is bigger then the best western suite down the street. The kids loved it... we just reserved another room for this march ..
Manager Response: We are so glad to hear that our last room in February was a perfect fit for your kids’ surprise trip to Disneyland in February! What a fun surprise!! Thank you for taking the time to let us know that you were quite satisfied with your visit and, we are so happy to hear that you have already booked another stay with us for this month!!  Please let us know when you will be arriving! We look forward to having you and your family return!!  Thank you again!  The Castle Inn & Suites Management

Summary: We stayed 4 nights-2/20 to 2/24, in a parlor suite.  It had a sofa, coffe table & TV in the "parlor", which made it convenient for dining in (there's a 24-hour Subway next door for dinner, and we ate cereal and juice before walking to Disney in the early AM).  The price was $128 a night--excellent value for the budget-minded compared to other suites in the area..  Staff was courteous and helpful, (and wearing a white shirt with the Castle Logo--what's this about a uniform?).  We arrived before chieck-in, around 10 AM, and they stored our luggage in a secure locker right next to the reception desk so we could go on to D-land.  they arranged to call us when a room was ready, which they did around 2 pm.  Our room were on the second floor toward the rear.  It was clean and made up
Manager Response: We wanted to say thank you for the time you took to post comments on Trip Advisor regarding your stay last week! We are thrilled to hear that you were happy with your visit and appreciate you touching on several of the attributes which enhanced your stay.   We passed along your kind words to our staff and are glad that they lived up to your expectations.  Thank you again! We look forward to having you back to stay with us in the future!  The Castle Inn & Suites Management

Summary Heading: Clean, Great price for location, Staff very helpful.
Summary: Another great stay.. I had a suite that has two sinks one inside the bathroom and one out, the one on the outside of the bathroom drained extremly slow(like as in not a useful sink), we made due with the one inside. I never really said anything but I'm sure the staff would have fixed it if I did ( me being lazy and after being at the parks all day, all I wanted to do is shower and sleep.) but great place for the price and food options all around.
Manager Response: Hi Evan,  Thank you so much for responding to my other message! We wanted to thank you, again, for your comments and for your honesty regarding your stay earlier this month. We are so happy to hear that you enjoyed this stay and are sorry to hear that the sink was causing you some problems. We have looked into that issue and it has been fixed.   As I mentioned in my message to you, on your next visit, please don’t hesitate to contact us should anything come up while you are here as we would love to be able to get it taken care of for you as soon as possible.  I have passed along your nice words about our staff to the other managers to pass along and appreciate you mentioning them in your review.   Thank you also for being a loyal guest and returning to stay with us! We look forward to your next visit! Please let us know when you will be coming!  The Castle Inn & Suites Management

Summary Heading: I WAS A BIT CONCERNED AFTER I READ SOME OF THE REVIEWS.
Summary: As a family tradition we take the entire family to Disney land when our kids graduate.As the family has grown that means spouses And Grandchildren also. We wanted a hotel that was very close so we could bring the younger ones back for rest time if needed. And for all the separate rooms needed, The hotel had to be budget friendly. We were concerned with some of the reviews we read. We thought if it does not work we will check out. The rooms are big with fridges. (Which was nice for pop and goodies for everyone).The pool was great. And Mc Donalds and other eating places almost next door. The rooms were very clean and the clientel very friendly. And right across the street is Disneyland! It is not Trump tower. But, We will stay there again.
Manager Response: We are so happy to hear that you and your family had a great trip to Disneyland and that you were satisfied with your stay at the Castle Inn & Suites.  We appreciate that you are a free thinker and decided to stay with us regardless of the reviews that caused you some initial concern.   As you mentioned, we are centrally located and within walking distance to many wonderful eating establishments as well as within a 7 minute walk to the Disneyland Main entrance.   How fun that your grandchildren were able to rehash their day when seeing the rides at the Park from their room! What great family vacation memories you have!!  Thank you for your time and comments! We are looking forward to your return visit!   Regards,  The Castle Inn & Suites Management

Summary: This hotel looked wonderful online, the reviews were good, and the price was right for a family suite with three beds so I was excited when we checked in! The staff was friendly, though not in a uniform (not a big deal.)  The keys were older, the kind with the holes, which worried me. When we walked in we noticed how out of date this hotel really was. The beds were terrible, the comforters smelled. The pillows were flat. Curtains had mold on the bottoms from the air conditioners. The refrigerator was so noisy. The bathroom was horrible, water pressure was depressing and my daughter's hair straightener blew the fuse so we were without power in the bathroom when we came in from Disneyland after 11pm. The desk clerk told me how to reset the breaker over the phone! We checked out a
Manager Response: Jasmine,  Thank you for taking the time to post thoughts about your recent stay at the Castle Inn & Suites. We are sorry to hear that you were dissatisfied with your visit but would like to let you know that we do take all comments seriously and have looked into those you mentioned.  In reference to our rooms keys, our locks and doors are very safe and secure.   Should you have brought the issues you wrote about to our attention while you were here, we would have been more than happy to bring you more pillows, a new comforter, a new refrigerator or simply, we could have switched you to a new room.   Regarding the fuse going out, it was actually the GFI Electrical circuit, as required by building code and therefore, is made for the ease of resetting.  The desk clerk who helped you that night was doing so, by phone, because being that it does take only a few seconds to hit the reset button, that person figured that most guests, such as yourself, would like to reset it themselves rather than wait for maintenance to get to the room. This was probably of importance since it was after 11:00 p.m. and you had been at Disneyland all day.   I am sure that you are aware that occasionally elevators seem to have problems and ours happen to have its problem while you were here. It was actually fixed quickly, without incident or other complaints.  Last, we wanted to address your comments about whoever checked you in not being in a uniform:  our staff, especially our front desk staff, is always in a regulation uniform, while our managers  wear appropriate business attire.   Thank you again for your time!   The Castle Inn & Suites Management

Summary: great location..worn rooms but very clean. passed the bed bug check with flying colors. Refrigerator was a little loud but we turned on the heater and it drowned it out perfectly.  We had items too large for the security boxes but the front desk was more than accomodating at keeping it. Our flight was later than check-out time but they locked our luggage up until our shittle came so we could go back to Disneyland that morning. less than a 10 minute walk to maingate , no hassles of shuttles. Would definitely stay again!
Manager Response: Hello,  We are pleased to hear that you enjoyed your recent stay with us! Thank you for posting your comments on TripAdvisor and for reiterating our proximity to Disneyland. We are in an excellent location for those families who want the ease of walking back and forth to the Parks but not having to worry about a shuttle.   Thank you again! We look forward to having you return for another visit!  The Castle Inn & Suites Management

Summary: We spent a week here while we vacationed in the area.  The hotel is walking distance to Disneyland and close to some great restaurants in the Garden Walk Mall.  The pool was small but lots of fun and there is a little store on site for snacks and breakfast stuff.    There is no doubt the stuff in the rooms is a little long in the tooth, but it's all functional, comfortable and clean.  We had a "family suite" so that gave us a little more room and that was very nice.  The staff were helpful and nice.  Internet service is spotty at best.  If you have a laptop, the short walk to the main office will get you online for whatever you need to do because the coverage there is fine.  If your going to spend tons of time in your room (and why would you do that?) this may not be your best
Manager Response: We wanted to thank you for your time and comments regarding your stay at the Castle Inn & Suites.  We are so happy to hear that you were satisfied with your stay and equally happy with your Family Suite!  About your comments regarding our WiFi service, we are glad to be able to share with you, that we are currently in the process of upgrading our Complimentary WiFi service!   Thank you again!  The Castle Inn & Suites Management

Summary: It was economical and clean. The staff was very friendly. The location was fantastic. Are main reason for staying there was to be close enough to Disneyland to walk. It is also close to restaurants & store.
Manager Response: We wanted to take a moment to thank you for the time you took to right a review about you recent stay at the Castle Inn & Suites! We are pleased that you were happy with our proximity to the Parks and restaurants!   It is always nice to hear wonderful things about our staff and we always like to pass the kind words on, to the staff, whenever we receive them!  Thank you again for your time!  The Castle Inn & Suites Management

Summary: The rooms were better than we expected after reading several reviews.  We spent little time in the room as Disneyland was our main priority.  People who were complaining about distance make no sense as if you are a Disneyland, you will clearly be walking around a lot.  I think we were in a recently re-modeled room.   Booked on Getawaytoday.com so we got at great price and got one night for free so value was great for the room!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the comments you posted regarding your stay. We are so appreciative of your time and thoughts. Our location is one of our best selling points and we are thrilled to hear that you would agree!  Thank you again! We hope you will stay with us when your travels bring you back to Anaheim.   The Castle Inn & Suites Management

Summary Heading: Good Price but it has its drawbeacks.....
Summary: Good location to go to Disneyland-  had makeup turn up missing as well as a pair of pants- The room wasn't cleaned the one day when we had gotten back from the park
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the review regarding your stay in October, 2011. We take all comments very seriously and very much appreciate that you responded to our inquiry message.  It is with comments such as yours that help us to continue improving our service!  Thank you again for your time and comments. We look forward to your return  later this month!  The Castle Inn & Suites Management

Summary: Had the pleasure of staying at the Castle Inn and Suites in late September 2011.  We stayed in a room with three beds - which was really handy for two adults and two teenagers.  It was close enough to Disneyland to walk.  Nearby were lots of food options including Subway, 7-11, Dennys, I-Hop.  Strongly recommend staying here if you are going to Disneyland.  Very clean and tidy.  Staff were friendly.
Manager Response: Deanne: thank you so very much for your kind comments regarding your stay in September! We are so happy to hear that you really enjoyed your stay with us and that our staff, once again, lived up to our expectations! We are so lucky to be located where we are, in such close walking proximity to Disneyland, as well as right in the middle of numerous food options and are glad that you were able to use all of it to your advantage while you were here!  We hope you had a great trip home and look forward to having you stay with us in the future when you return for another trip to Disneyland!  Thank you!  The Castle Inn & Suites Management

Summary: We stayed last year and not only was the top blanket on our bed dirty (weird stains on the underside!!) but our room's shower didn't work. Awful -- I would avoid this hotel again at all costs.  The only good part about this hotel is that the front office said we able to leave our car parked here while we went to Disneyland after we'd already checked out.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to post your comments on Trip Advisor regarding your trip from last February.  We are sorry to hear that you were disappointed with your stay but appreciate what you had to say and are looking into the items you discussed.    Thank you again for your comments.  Regards,  The Castle Inn & Suites Management

Summary: We stayed for 10 days in October 2010.  We decided it would be fun to be in Disneyland for Halloween.  We traveled with 4 adults and 2 youth.  My husband and I were in a standard room (pictured) and my parents with my brother and sister had the family suite.  The hotel itself is pretty basic as are the rooms: bed, mini-fridge, TV, small table, etc. It met our needs for the trip... only because we didn't end up spending very much time in the room itself and it was close enough to get to by foot after a long day at the park.    The hotel is about a 7-10 minute walk to the Disneyland/California Adventure entrance.  There is no restaurant located in the hotel, but there are plenty of places to eat with in a 3-8 minute walking distance depending on what you're looking for.  We didn't
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post comments about your stay at the Castle Inn & Suites in October. We are disappointed to hear that you were not completely satisfied with your visit and appreciate your candor. We are so glad to hear that you were happy with our location and that getting to and from the area restaurants, with ease, was a benefit for you.    We hope that you will allow us another opportunity to serve you when your travels bring you back to Anaheim.  Thank you again!  The Castle Inn & Suites Management

Summary Heading: if you just want a place to sleep.
Summary: My family and I went this past December.  The location was GREAT to Disneyland.  It was about a 10 mins walk from our hotel room to the front gate.  If you're looking just for a place to sleep and don't care about comfort, this is the hotel for you.  The front staff (the only ones we had contact with) was very nice.  The beds were pretty bad and the pillows were horrible.  I kinda just gave up on finding a comfortable one.  If we go again, more than likely- unless there's absolutely nothing else, I would not stay here again.  The castle theme was cute, but so out dated.  The price was super great, but next time I'm going to pay a little more and get more comfort.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your recent review of the Castle Inn & Suites. We are pleased to hear that you were satisfied with your stay, as well as with the ease of the walk to the front gates of the Disneyland Resort . We are also thrilled that our staff continues to be the mainstay of our customer service.    We hope that they next time you are in Anaheim, you will give us another try!  Thank you again!  The Castle Inn & Suites Management

Summary Heading: A Perfect Time with Perfect People * * * * *  : )
Summary: I had a Perfect time at the Castle Inn...the Staff was Absolutely Amazing...my room was perfect it really made my visit being able to look out the Window along Harbor Blvd...Thank you so much...I hope I can have the same room next time...I really got to know the Hotel Staff so well when each day I would visit the Lobby with my Lab Top.. they were always answering the phone ensuring all their Guests needs were met..extra towels, Beddings..etc..so personable every time...I look forward to staying at the Castle Inn again next time...It was a Wonderful 11 days...The Staff who looked after the room were wonderful , always happy and cheerful...there was this one fella who had a cold and his voice was gone...what an effort he made to ensure things went just how he would want them to
Manager Response: Christmas Smiles…..welcome back!! Thank you, once again, for the comments on your second stay with us last month! We are so happy that you returned and had “perfect time” !  Thank you, also, for the nice words about our staff! We pride ourselves in the fact that our staff is knowledgeable, friendly, helpful and bottom line, the best front line for our hotel!  We look forward to your visit again this December. When you make your reservation, please note  what your favorite room is  and we will do our absolute best to accommodate your request!  Thank you again and have a wonderful 2012!  The Castle Inn & Suites Management

Summary: Where to start.... The beds were deplorable. Woke up with bruises from the springs. I actually slept sitting up with my own pillows from the car. I'll be visiting the chiropractor for the next couple weeks. On the second day, the room was never made up. When my partner asked the house keeper for towels the next morning, he couldn't understand what we were asking for. We went shopping from the cart for what we needed. When the house keeper came in, he used the same wash cloth to wipe the counters as he used to wipe down the shower and the toilet. Since I've had a double lung transplant, I carry bleach wipes & handed them to him... He said "I just clean" handed them back and left, which makes me wonder if they even clean or change sheets. We ended up cutting our trip 2 days short.
Manager Response: Mr. V,  Thank you for responding to the direct inquiry we sent you!  We wanted to make you aware that we have looked into the issues that you brought to our attention. It is through comments such as yours that we are able to address guest concerns.   Thank you again!  The Castle Inn & Suites Management

Summary: We arrive at the hotel very early and I went inside to check if we could park our car there and they actually let us have our room early as it was ready, this was a fantastic bonus.  I was a bit worried about the hotel but it is very clean and nice and close to Disney.  Although all the hotels along that rd are very close so if you are like me and trying to decide which is closer, they are all very close.  If all you want is a place to lay your head at night then this is your hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the wonderful comments about your stay at the Castle Inn & Suites. We are so appreciative of the time you took to post on TripAdvisor and are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your visit!   We hope that you will think of us again on your return to visit to Anaheim.  Thank you again!  The Castle Inn & Suites Management

Summary: I was a bit unsure about this motel as there had been mixed reviews.....upon arrival we were met with a very straight faced check in clerk who was very matter of fact about everything and not very personable....ok, maybe that's his personality.....check in lobby was very clean and tidy so felt comfortable staying...... We were on the 4th floor (2 rooms) myself, husband and our 10 month old daughter, and my mum and her freind in another room......thankfully the lift worked, although it wasn't the most pleasant ride at times! Our room was very outdated, but in fairness clean....and tidy, clean bathroom and sink area.  Motel's aren't my favourite place to stay and although this was good value for money I think I would rather stay somewhere else like the marriott or red lion on our
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to put the comments about your recent stay with us in writing. We are happy to hear that while you were unsure about actually staying here, due to previous reviews, you decided to stay anyway! We realize that it is impossible to make everyone happy, although It is our goal to do so, I am glad that your visit was satisfactory and you were pleased with the cleanliness of our rooms.   I hope that you will keep us in mind when you return to Anaheim as we are a short walk to the Disney parks and we are located right in the middle of numerous restaurants and shopping.  Again, thank you for your feedback!  The Castle Inn & Suites Management

Summary Heading: Outside is questionable but inside is very clean! :)
Summary: I made reservations ahead of time for Castle Inn because I loved how it's almost right across the street from the park.  Once there we realized the appearance on the outside from afar looked pretty cool considering it looks like a castle, however, once you get a little closer it's a bit shabby.  The inside was nothing great but it was very clean! Overall for the price we were satisfied :)
Manager Response: We are pleased to hear that you were satisfied with your stay last month, here, at the Castle Inn & Suites. We are so thankful that you posted your comments and hope that you will stay with us again on your next visit to Anaheim!  Thank you again!  The Castle Inn & Suites Management

Summary Heading: Great Price Close to Disneyland and Clean!
Summary: Another great stay at the Castle Inn.. Said it once and ill say it again Awesome close place to stay with clean rooms and very friendly staff...again let us leave the car even after we checked out to enjoy a couple more hours in the Parks!...Thanks Castle Inn!
Manager Response: We are thrilled to hear that you enjoyed your latest stay with us! Thank you for taking the time to tell us about your visit. We are so appreciative of your kind words and look forward to your return!!  Thank you again!  The Castle Inn & Suites Management

Summary Heading: Good value for money and great for families
Summary: On a visit to Disneyland with our 18 year old daughter we were pleasantly surprised by the accommodation offered at this property. Having a two-bedroom apartment was an essential and this property was clean and comfortable. Being literally across the road from the Disneyland parks was an added bonus. We would recommend this property for families and/or couples looking to travel to Anaheim.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the time you took to post comments about your recent stay at the Castle Inn & Suites. We are thrilled to hear that your stay was enjoyable and that you would recommend us to friends!   Thank you for choosing the Castle Inn & Suites and for your comments! We hope to see you again, on your next visit to Anaheim!  The Castle Inn & Suites Management

Summary Heading: Walking distance to the park before your legs fall off!!
Summary: My daughters love the hotel it looks like a castle and they get so excited when they see the lions outside!! sure it's a little older but the price is right no paying for parking BS!! It truley is walking distance especially if your pushing a double stroller! We have stayed here 2 times and are coming back again!!
Manager Response: Ms. Cueba….thank you so very much for the nice comments about your recent visit to the Castle Inn & Suites! I am so happy to hear that your daughters get excited when they come here and that they love seeing our lions outside!   I am so glad that you mentioned that we do not have a parking fee as that is one of our attributes and we are really thrilled that we haven’t had to initiate one.  As a mother with a double stroller, it is refreshing to hear of the ease with which you were able to get to and from the hotel to the Parks  and in a short amount of time.   Thank you again for your comments! We look forward to your third visit with us and hope that it will be soon!  The Castle Inn & Suites Management

Summary: We have stayed at the Castle Inn when we do a two day trip to Disneyland.  Wonderful place, free parking for one car when the others charge $9 or more, and spacious rooms.  The sofa in the mini parlor had a thin mattress, but the separation wall was great.  The kids could believe they were in a different room.  This is my first choice for a hotel.  Only suggestions are to get thicker mattresses on the sofas, and new carpet in the rooms.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the nice comments you posted regarding your recent stay at the Castle Inn & Suites! We are so happy to hear you enjoyed your visit and that your kids were excited about the room you were in.  We understand that additional costs while traveling are frustrating and we are glad that we are able to provide complimentary parking for our guests.   Thank you again for your time! We look forward to your return visit in the future!  The Castle Inn & Suites Management

Summary: I stayed here the first time with a friend in March 2010 and it was great.  Big and clean rooms, comfy beds, very quiet.  Good water pressure in the showers.  So when my family and I knew we were going to Disneyland this month (Dec 2011), I booked a room without looking at other places.  What a mistake.  This time, while the rooms were still very clean, there was nothing much else good about it.  The beds were rock hard, I had to keep turning over because my shoulders would start aching.  The bathroom door squeaked so loud that if you got up in the middle of the night, opening the door would wake the whole room.  There were rips and tears in the sheets on both beds.  I realize this is an old hotel, but that doesn't mean the bedding has to be old too.  The shower temperature
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post comments regarding your recent stay. We are sorry to hear that you were disappointed with your recent stay but are taking your comments very seriously and are looking into them.   We are proud of our Customer Service and our Staff is always happy to help guests when the guest feels that something might be wrong or there is a problem, especially when they have been notified while the guests are still on property.    Thank you again for your time! We hope you will reconsider and stay with us again on a future visit.   The Castle Inn & Suites Management

Summary: It is a couple of minutes walk to the main entrance of Disney and parking is free for one car. No breakfast, the room was ok, bathroom was clean.  Front desk was friendly . The facade did look like a castle, tough I think the rooms could do an update since the carpet was a little worn out.  A good value since the other nearby hotels and motels are more pricey.
Manager Response: We wanted to take a minute to say thank you for recent comments. We are so happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay and appreciate your nice words about our staff!  We look forward to having you stay with us again in the future! Thank you again for your time!  The Castle Inn & Suites Management

Summary Heading: Good location large, but worn rooms
Summary: This was our second time staying here. The walk to Disneyland is easy. The rooms are large and have refrigerators and microwaves. We didn't use the fridge though because it was SO loud when it was on. Didn't need it anyway, but if you are planning to use one, you might check to see if there are more quiet ones in some rooms. I did find the bed and pillows to be fairly uncomfortable and the room fairly worn out. The water pressure in the shower was nearly non-existent. My son kept waiting for the water to come on after it was already on. The tv picture was mostly static on most of the channels. We didn't complain because it didn't matter. Only used it briefly in the morning for my daughter. The staff was nice and honored my request for a certain room location, which was great.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing the Castle Inn & Suites, again, for your recent trip to Anaheim. We are thrilled that you continue to stay with us!  We appreciate your comments about your visit and have definitely looked into the items you mentioned.  We are certainly happy that our staff was able to accommodate your request to stay in a room in the location you prefer and that overall you had an enjoyable visit. It looks like you were in one of our Family Suites and we wanted to clarify that those suites have a king size bed and two queen size beds in them.    Thank you so much for your comments! We appreciate them very much and look forward to your third stay with us.   The Castle Inn & Suites Management

Summary Heading: Fairly priced, clean rooms, leaves you with choices
Summary: The Castle Inn and Suites is close enough to walk to Disneyland but for those long days or cold nights, the Anaheim Resort Transit has a stop very close. Also very close is a 24 hour Subway, a pizza place, Chinese food, and Mexican food. All cheaper alternatives to the regular Disney fare. The rooms are clean, housekeeping makes up room before lunchtime (in our experience), the front desk is friendly and helpful, and they have a decent pool and spa. Going through getawaytoday.com usually nets you the 3rd night free at The Castle. Great deal!! We have stayed before and will come back again!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your kind comments regarding your stay with us earlier this month! We are so happy to hear that you continue to return and always enjoy your visit.    We are lucky to be located in such a good location, which showcases the local restaurants in the area. There are several choices, as you mentioned and it is very easy to walk to any of them.   Thank you again for your time! We look forward to your next visit!  The Castle Inn & Suites Management

Summary: This place has bed bugs and the staff doesn't seem to care. When we brought the one bug we found down to them the man at the front shrugged and said, "yes that does happen. We have many international guests". We were given a refund but no type of compensation let alone apology for the fact that we had to find a new hotel at 12:30am the night before Thanksgiving. Don't stay here unless you want bed bugs!
Manager Response: Please be assured that the Castle Inn & Suites is proactive in all pest control issues and we use a national pest control company who regularly inspects and services our rooms. While we understand your concern with the bug you found in your room, bugs can get into rooms through an open door, open window or on luggage. Our staff, which is trained to look for such things, and the pest control service thoroughly inspected the room after you checked out and found no evidence of bugs.   We pride ourselves in our customer service and cleanliness of rooms.  We did offer a complimentary suite, along with the refund and are sorry that you did not feel that the offer was adequate.  The Castle Inn & Suites Management

Summary: Castle Inn and Suites is within walking distance to Disneyland.  The staff was very helpful and friendly.  The rooms are a bit dated but came with a mini refrigerator and coffee maker.  Our room was cleaned daily.   For the number of proper staying at the suites, it was very quiet.  Wifi connection was sketchy.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to post your comments about your recent stay at the Castle Inn & Suites! We are happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay and that our staff lived up to all expectations!  Thank you for bringing up the issues with the WiFi!  Rest assured, we are definitely looking into it.   Thank you again for your review! We look forward to having you stay with us on a future visit.   The Castle Inn & Suites Management

Summary Heading: Great Value for money and very friendly staff!!
Summary: We stayed here for 5 nights in October as part of a two centre stop taking in LA & Vegas. As we we're splashing out on a top hotel in Vegas we wanted something a little more affordable in LA, so opted to stay in Anaheim and rent a car to get around. The Castle Inn & Suites did not let us down - i'd read some of the negative reports on trip advisor, but am a great beleiver in finding out for yourself. We arrived after a very long flight from the UK , and then grabbed the car at LAX and drove down to Anaheim, where we were greeted by very friendly staff. The check in was quick and the room was spacious, clean and more than adequate. Ok the carpet could do with replacing and the bed is a little firm , but given what we paid , and the location is great for Disney - ten minutes walk
Manager Response: We are so happy to hear that you are “finding out for yourself” type of guests and decided to trust your instincts for your stay earlier this month at the Castle Inn & Suites! Thank you for the wonderful comments regarding your visit. We realize that you had a busy trip, being from the UK and having traveled from Las Vegas, but we feel comments like yours present a positive outlook to those who also read and trust reviews by others when they are booking a trip!   We are glad that you had a memorable trip and we look forward to seeing you when you return to the Castle Inn & Suites another time! Thank you again for your time!  The Castle Inn & Suites Management

Summary: We chose Castle Inn and Suites after reading many reviews of the various hotels that are within walking distance to Disneyland.  It seemed to provide the most convenience for the best price.  We had just spent a week in Yosemite and Sequoia National Parks, so the short walk to the turnstiles was quite quick & easy for us.  I suppose it may be considered a "long" walk to some, but really, you'll be spending the time walking around the parks anyway.  There were a few restaurants along the way, including a small pizza and Chinese food place that were both fine but unmemorable, and an IHOP which had kids meals free with adult entrees.  The hotel was clean and our room had a refrigerator, which was a plus.  The pool and hot tub were also clean -- and well used by our family.  There
Manager Response: Thank you for the comments regarding your family’s stay at the Castle Inn & Suites. We are pleased that you chose our hotel for your visit to Anaheim and that you had an enjoyable trip! We are also happy to hear that the convenience of our location to the main entrance of the Disney parks were a main draw for you.   We appreciate the time you took to post your comments and hope that you will stay with us again the next time you visit Anaheim.   The Castle Inn & Suites Management

Summary: This was the 2nd quirky 'Camlot/Castle' themed hotel stayed in and is bery much the same as the Camelot hotel, but is even better dited for Disney. Again, good clean and friendly with as others have already commented on, a lovely outside hot tub
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to post comments about your stay at the Castle Inn & Suites in November! We are so happy that you enjoyed your visit and hope you will stay with us again when you return to Anaheim!  Thank you again!  The Castle Inn & Suites Management

Summary: My son and I have just returned from a Halloween trip to Disneyland, (great fun). and while we were in Anaheim, we stayed at the Castle inn. We head down to OC a lot, (every year for about the last 20), yet we had never picked the Castle for our "home away from home", Our loss. Not only was it well priced, but the place was very good on all counts.  First off the staff was fantastic!  Super friendly, and professional. fast check in, always some one there when you needed any thing.  The hotel/Inn it self was very very clean, our room was spotless, and quiet. This is going to sound odd, but for a good value hotel, it just smelled good... clean, not that old hotel stale. Any way it was just really nice. The beds are firm! so if you like that great! I do not lol. but again super
Manager Response: We are thrilled to hear that you had such a nice stay with us when you were here in November! Thank you for all of the nice comments and for taking the time to post them on Trip Advisor!  We look forward to seeing you when you return on your next Halloween trip in 2012!  Again, thank you so much!  The Castle Inn & Suites Management

Summary: We stayed at Castle earlier this year and thought it was OK so we decided to stay there again because the rooms were less expensive.  This visit seemed to lack customer service.  The rooms are starting to show their age and in need of minor repair.  The beds are a little hard and the pillows a little flat, but ok for the good price.  We booked 3 rooms for our family and only one had good tv, the other two were not clear and one had a remote that didn't work.  The mirror was never cleaned, I noticed the same spots each day.  We had plenty of towels, cups and soap the first day, but they did not restock daily as you might expect.  The walk to Disneyland is not as close as I would like, but to get any closer it costs at least $20 more per night for similiar accomodations.  I much
Manager Response: Thank you for the time and thought you put in to the comments you posted regarding your stay at the Castle Inn & Suites in November. We truly appreciate everything you said and are definitely looking in to some of the notes you made.  We apologize for the fact that you did not have rooms together as requested. We cannot guarantee that rooms will be next door or even close together especially when we are busy the night before an arrival with such requests.    We thank you again for your time and hope that you will stay with us again in the future.  The Castle Inn & Suites Management

Summary: The location of this hotel is great, just a short walk to the main gate. The staff is very accommodating with any suggestions for things to do or needs you might have. We found that the house keeping was excellent and we left a tip on the pillow every morning as we felt they earned it. My husband and I stayed three nights with zero problems. If you are looking for a clean room with helpful staff at a good price, then this is a great hotel. We will be back again in the summer.
Manager Response: We are so happy to hear that you enjoyed your visit with us in November! Thank you for your enthusiastic comments and kind words about our staff!  As I am sure you know, our staff is the heart and soul of the hotel so we are always pleased to hear that they are living up to all expectations!  Thank you again and we will see you again in the summer!  The Castle Inn & Suites Management

Summary Heading: For a trip planned on short notice an no other rooms available...price was right an its like ten minutes from the maingate enter
Summary: We stayed two nights in an executive suite. For our poor planning abilites it was the right price for the location...I paid 241 for two nights in the suite..it had two comfortable queen beds, and a pullout queen couch mini fridge, microwave, which if split between three people comes to 80 bucks each for two nights you can't beat that for the cleanliness, location and comfort...huge room..fridge worked awesome. Front desk very prompt an helpful...elevator is very helpful after a long day at the Disney parks.... food options and a cornerstore market right next door..when we checked out they let us leave our car so we could enjoy one last day at the park...It was a Monday when we checked out, they might not be able to on a weekend because they tend to be more busy...Awesome older
Manager Response: We are delighted to hear that you were satisfied with your last minute hotel choice in the Castle Inn & Suites for your stay in October. We are so pleased that you enjoyed the location, comfort, room amenities, complimentary parking and caring staff, all of  which enhanced your visit.  Thank you so much for your comments! We appreciate your time and look forward to having you stay with us again when you return to Anaheim!  The Castle Inn & Suites Management

Summary: The location to the main gate of Disneyland is perfect.  It is only about a block and and half away.  The office staff was very helpful.  The hotel is nothing special, but for the price and location you can't beat it.  We will stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time out of your busy schedule to post comments about your recent stay at the Castle Inn & Suites.  We are thrilled to hear that you were so happy with our close, walking proximity to Disneyland and that our staff was very helpful to you! It is always rewarding to hear our guests say they will stay with us again!  We look forward to your return sometime soon!  The Castle Inn & Suites Management

Summary: Even after reading some of the reviews, I was still skeptical of this place due to the price.  Yes, the rooms are outdated.  But if you are going to Disneyland, you will not really be staying in the room to enjoy the decor anyways.  Our room was clean and the shower flow was fine.  As previous posters have mentioned, the bed was uncomfortable.  But other than that, the room did it's purpose.
Manager Response: Thank you for being a free thinker, disregarding some of the reviews that you read and staying with us in October! I appreciate your honesty and the time you took to make the posting.  I am so happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay while here to go to Disneyland.   Thank you again for your time and comments! We hope to see you again on a return visit!  The Castle Inn & Suites Management

Summary Heading: The perfect vacation accommodation in Anaheim
Summary: Ok, so it's not the CLOSEST accommodation to Disneyland, BUT, it's less than 10 minutes walk, or about a block and a half.  The rooms are not modern, but are spacious and clean, with comfortable bedding, great water presssure, drip filter coffee, small fridge, and the staff are more than accommodating with any requests, area information, transfer arrangements, even local cab requirements.  It also has free wifi, which I could get (reasonably well) from our room on the 4th floor. The only draw back was that the gift shop seemed to close on a whim whenever the attendant decided he needed to go somewhere (not the hotel's fault, and there were plenty of shops within walking disance anyway, so I just didn't use the gift shop).  The pool was clean and well maintained, as were the
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your comments. I really appreciate you taking the time to share your recent experience at the Castle Inn & Suites.  We are all pleased to hear that the room was satisfactory to your needs while you were here and we have passed on your concerns regarding the gift shop to the owner of the gift shop. We are really lucky to be located where we are, in close walking proximity to numerous shops and restaurants, as well as to the Disney Parks.   Thank you again for your kind words! We look forward to your return, from Oz, next Christmas!!  The Castle Inn & Suites Management

Summary: Stayed here for 6 nights in late September with our 23 month old and 4 year old. We had a family suite, and it was a very good rate for the size of the room - we had a king sized bed in the front sitting room, and each of the kids had their own Queen bed in the bedroom. There wasn't a lot of space in the front entrance, but there was a lot of space for suitcases etc in the bedroom. We had a problem with our fridge, but they came up within ten minutes after we called and replaced it with a working one. Our room was always cleaned when we returned from Disneyland. The kids loved how the staff arranged their toys on the bed as if they had been playing. Each day, they rushed into the bedroom to see what the toys had been doing while we were out. It only took us about 10 minutes to
Manager Response: I am so happy to hear that you and your family enjoyed your recent stay with us! We appreciate all of your nice comments and are certainly looking into those concerns that you did had.  I love to hear that your daughter was so excited about being the “princess” of the castle and that she was including her brother as the prince!  Our staff is here to make your stay comfortable so I am pleased that the kids would rush in every day to see that their ”toys were doing” while you were gone!!    Thank you again for your time in making the comments! We are grateful to have guests like you  who want to provide feedback to other guests!  The Castle Inn & Suites Management

Summary: It was a pleasant experience from the moment we walked in!  I am a smoker and was pleasantly surprised to find out that "Smoking" rooms were actually available!  We travel to Disneyland quite often and this was our first time to this establishment and I can honestly say that "We will be back"!!  Thanks again to the staff @ Castle Inn & Suites, Anaheim, CA, you were all GREAT!!
Manager Response: We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your recent stay with us and that you will be back someday. Thank you very much for your comments and enthusiasim! We look forward to seeing you on your future stays!  Thank you again!  The Castle Inn & Suites Management

Summary: We  stayed at the Castle Inn  for 3 nights.The first room smelled like  wet dog.  We were moved next door- that room was clean but very worn.  Carpet was thread bare.  Pillows were  flat and firm. The beds were old and hard.  The lamps at bedside did not work. The A/C was very loud. The wi-fi did not work at all.  The shower was more like a sprinkle.  No water pressure and the shower head was clogged.  This hotel is not across the street from Disney and it is not a 7 minute walk.  I visit Disney three for four times a year.  But I will NEVER stay at this hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: There are always bumps in the road from time to time with hotel conditions...The Castle does have some rooms that may need a little extra TLC....but I tell you the truth no one likes to be cursed at, if things just aren't quite right.. I found myself having to go to the office with a few concerns....one which was just a simple mistake...the hotel was not quite ready with my room and said that I should go off and enjoy my day...they would put my bags in the room for me...That was just fine with me...When I arrived back later in the evening...I went into my room to find that it was a smoking room...it really went thru my clothing in my bags...I went down to the office and just told the office staff of the problem...in a kind manner....they immediately apolozied..and had my room
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to comment on your stay with us in December of 2009. We appreciate all reviews about the hotel and are happy to hear that you will be back to stay with us this December.  Please be sure to contact us directly if we can be of any further assistance.  Thank you again!  The Castle Inn & Suites Management

Summary: A no frills motel with access to Disneyland. Have stayed here multiple times for location and affordability. Easy, walkable, and safe access to the Harbor entrance of Disneyland. Also good access to affordable eateries on Harbor so you don't have to pay park prices. This hotel serves its purpose when you spend 15 hours in Disneyland.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed in a Parlor suite in Castle Inn and Suites in August 2011. This hotel looks lovely and you can even pose for a picture in front of it. However, the rooms are quite unremarkable and a bit old, though reasonably clean. Parlor suite has a bedroom with 2 beds and a "living room" with sofa sleeper, microwave and refrigerator. Refrigerator is large enough to accommodate drinks, snacks and leftover pizza. Both rooms have TVs and air conditioners. Air conditioners can be adjusted for temperature, but not for direction in which they blow air. There is one bathroom as well. In the bathroom I meet a spider, who appeared to be lost. I tried to be nice and helped him out of the suite. Coffee machine was leaking the water so quick that we didn't have any chance to taste
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: We switched hotels after the first night
Summary: I though this hotel looked adorable from the outside, unfortunately the inside was horrid. The carpets had severe wear - to the point where there were visible high-traffic areas where the carpet pattern was worn off - on top of being dingy. Somehow the beds managed to be simultaneously rock hard and flimsy. Not one of the five of us were able to sleep. We had a suite with 2 queen beds and a sofa bed, which was a cruel joke. My 12-year-old son described it best as "a sheet over springs." The bathroom was ok, not as bad as the sleeping areas.   The staff was nice enough; they had no problem letting us out of the rest of our stay without charge. We moved across the street to a far nicer hotel (that was not much more expensive at all) and were so much happier there.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to let us know about your stay earlier this month!  While we are disappointed to hear that you were unhappy with the night you stayed with us, we are hoping you will give us another chance sometime in the future!  Thank you again!  The Castle Inn & Suites Management

Summary: Price was ok, found others at the same price with a continental breakfast offered.  Chose this one because of the theme.  Let down tho.  The AC unit was literally broke - if you bumped it the face came off.  The room smelled very musty and the bathroom smelled moldy.  Even had some mold in the corner of the tub.  The shower - at 6 am when it should be ok - ran hot and cold.  The toilet ran - plan on handle jiggling.  Our white socks were grey in 15 minutes - so no 5 second rules here.  Wyfy was very slow - not that is a big deal.  TV reception kept going in and out as well as the remote needed batteries - we used our own for our stay.  The family suite was nice - it had two rooms but don't plan on it being perfect.  I doubt I would stay here again.  The hotel snack shop closes
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is my third stay at Castle Inn & Suites this year! Everytime I look to book a trip to Disneyland this place always has the best value and great location! Of course it's nothing fancy but if you are looking for a comfortable, clean hotel within walking distance to the parks this place would be perfect for you. The rooms don't come with irons and ironing boards but everytime I have called the front desk to ask for one, it's set to my room within 5 or 10 minutes. Housekeeping always did a great job with our room, adding little touches like making a little bow with the toilet paper rather than the typical triangle at the end. Overall this place is great and I will most likely book this place again for my next trip.
Manager Response: We are so happy to hear that you continue to stay at the Castle Inn & Suites when you come to Anaheim! Thank you for making us your hotel of choice for each stay and than you so much for the kind words about our staff! We really appreciate your time.  We look forward to seeing you again when you are here for future stays!  Thank you again!  The Castle Inn & Suites Management

Summary: Castle Inn's staff was very accommodating.  The room was as expected and the location is very convenient to Disney and several reasonable priced restaurants.
Manager Response: We wanted to say thank you for taking the time out of your schedule to comment on your recent stay at the Castle Inn & Suites! We are appreciative of all comments are are glad you enjoyed your stay!  Thank you again!  The Castle Inn & Suites Management

Summary: We were pleasantly  surprised.  We had a double and our daughter, husband and 4 children had a suite.  Both were large and clean.   The staff is friendly and responsive.  It is a short walk to D.land for which we were grateful.  The beds were comfortable; plenty of bath linens; always clean upon our return.  For the price it can't be beat.   Close to restaurants (Denny's, IHOP(way over priced) Cold Stone, Tony Romas, etc. on the way to D.land so did not have to use the car the whole weekend.   We would stay there again and recommend it to others.
Manager Response: We are thrilled to hear that you and your family enjoyed your stay with us when you were here in July!! Thank you so much for your comments and for recommending us to others! The best compliments we can get, are when our guests refer us to their friends!  Thank you again! We look forward to your return!  The Castle Inn & Suites Management

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for disneyland visit
Summary: Reasonable cost . Clean rooms though somewhat dated. Set up like a castle on the outside - exciting for kids and very close to disneyland - we walked there both days!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to let us know about your stay at the Castle Inn & Suites last month! We are glad to hear that you were happy with your stay!!  Thank you again!  The Castle Inn & Suites Management

Summary Heading: It was not fancy, but it was clean.
Summary: The rooms are getting a little long in the tooth, but everything was clean. We asked for extra pillows and towels and didn't have a problem getting extras. Our TV died at one point and it was taken care of the next day. The staff is friendly and helpful. The front desk put us in touch with a driver when we were going to a show and he was very good. If you are looking for a clean room, this is the place. Don't expect anything fancy.
Manager Response: We appreciate the time that it took for you to comment on your recent stay at the Castle Inn & Suite!  We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay!  Thank you again for your time! We look forward to your return!!  The Castle Inn & Suites Management

Summary: The service was extremely great here.  The workers were happy to help us--Our HBO channel went down, and as soon as we told them they said they would have someone check it out.  Within a couple hours, we got our cable back.   When the internet went down, one of the workers even offered his iPhone for our use!  All our questions and requests were given quickly.  It was a pleasant stay.  More...you can get delivery from so many places...pizza, Chinese, Italian, Mexican, etc.  The location was great for walking to Disney Land/Adventure & if you need a shuttle, the shuttle stop is right outside the hotel.  Extremely RECOMMENDED!!!!

The Castle Inn & Suites Management

Summary Heading: Ok...if your on a really tight budget

The hotel is old, the rooms are on the small side and has a very small television.  I was travel with my husband, a teen and a pre-teen.  It was tight quarters.  The beds are very uncomfortable and the walls super thin.  Also regardless of what they advertise or tell you at the front desk...there is NO high speed internet.  The pool is nasty. This is neither, but it's sufficent, clean, well staffed, and convenient. You also can easily park two full size strollers in a standard room and the staff is excellent. Every room has a half size fridge, internet, and coffee maker. The refrigerators make it nice when you have drinks that you need to be cold so that you can save money by not buying drinks in Disneyland. Unfortunately when on vacation we tend to eat fastfood and there are leftovers that need to be reheated.  I was advised by the front desk that the microwave in the gift shop is accessible even without purchasing anything from them. The downside to that is, who wants to walk to the gift shop to heat food? Fridge was cold and also microwave in room which is great since we brought things like oatmeal, ravioli and lunchables to save money. The rooms were good in general, although we had some problems with the toilet not flushing properly. it's an ok choice if you are on a tight budget.  we probably won't stay there again because of the noise from kids/teeangers playing in the swimming pool after 10pm (even though the hotel says the pool is close at 10pm, or something like that, can't remember the exact time). so after an exhausting day, we couldn't sleep til about 1030-11pm. then in the morning, we get woken up at like 7-8am with people walking pass the room and pushing their trolly bags....it gets quite noisy.....  apart from the noise....location wise, it's very convenient, 10 min walk to disney maingate.   also, very nice and helpful staff!

Summary Heading: A great time had by all

The day desk clerks were friendly and very helpful.  Maid service was great.  This is within walking distance to the main gate of Disneyland.  Near by are good places to eat,  Denny's, Tony Roma's, Subway, Panda Express,  McDonalds.   We would stay here again on our next trip to Disneyland.

Disneyland was only 2 blocks away, long blocks, but still close.  There was plenty of stuff around so we didn't need to go too far to get what we needed.  The only problems we had were that the ice machine was right outside our door and it was the only one working on that end of the building so it saw a lot of action all time of the day/night and there were always people filling up there coolers so one person would take like 5 minutes to fill up.  Also, they didn't tell us there was going to be construction.  The room directly above us was being renovated and they were jackhammering in the parking

The breakfast room was far too small for the number of units and also on the 5th floor with only 2 elevators available to reach it.. Menu items available were the normal continental ones, pastries, cereal, juice, coffee etc but best to get there earlier rather than later as supplies diminished - could be people taking too much earlier on, not sure.  We weren't overly impressed for the cost.

Summary: The best thing about Castle Inn is it is right across the road from California Adventure and about 10 minutes walk to Disney. Our room number was 342, it was clean but quite dark and the internet which is free wireless didnt work in there for some reason but if you had the door open or stepped outside the door it worked.  The staff are really great, very helpful and friendly. If you just want somewhere to crash after a hard day at Disney then its pretty good.

The hotel is directly across from Disneyland but is a 2-3 block walk to the actual main gate for the park but we were able to do this walk for 5 days with 3 children under 10 within 10 minutes.  For the rates they charge this hotel is an excellent value in my opinion compared to what you would get for the same rate at some of the chains in the area.

Summary: I stayed at the Castle Inn and Suites in Anaheim for one night.  The hotel was clean and comfortable.  Walking distance to the parks.  Parking was easy and free.  Hotel was quiet. Manager Response: none

Summary: This Inn is not as bad as it seems. Check in was a breeze and the desk clerk was extremely friendly. We went to our room and were afraid to open the door based on some other reviews that I had read. It was not the room I expected. The carpet had just been cleaned and everything looked nice. It is an older place so things were not new, but they were fine. Everything worked in our room and the toilet, sink and shower were clean. There was some mold on the bathroom door, but that was all I saw. The fridge was clean and housekeeping was great all 3 nights of our stay. They even changed the blanket that had a stain on it without us asking them to. It is a longer walk than the hotels across the street, but my husband(who has a pacemaker) and my 4 year old daughter made the trip twice
Manager Response: none

Summary: I read these reviews after I booked two rooms for my family and my heart sank. Once we got there and into our rooms it wasn't to bad. However, the most unsettling part of our room were the floors. Instead of being smooth the foundation was bumpy almost like big chunks were missing (and we were on the third floor). Summary: This inn, it is not a hotel, is not as bad as some make it out to be, but it is definitely not a castle either. Summary Heading: Not as nice as it used to be
Summary: When I stayed at this hotel with my family about 9 years ago, it was still a "budget" type of place.  It was, however, clean and well kept.  This year it is much different.    The housekeeping staff stinks, and so do the grounds!  The whole building could do with a nice power-washing.  The carpets need to be changed, the shower head was filthy, and did not get cleaned after I asked for it to be done. Summary Heading: You Can Have your Disney and Stay Right Too !
Summary: My family of 2 adults and 2 kids aged 10+ were at the Castle Inn for a total of 8 nights stay in Dec 2004.   What can be more perfect than stay in a very spacious double queen-sized bed room, free parking for hotel guests, breakfast thrown in, and a locale that can't be beaten?  I mean what more can you ask for ..   You can see the price is right up to suit the budget traveller, and yet it is the closest hotel to the objective of your stay in Anaheim - DISNEYLAND. It is right across the street no more than 20 meters ! Family restaurants such as Denny's, IHOP, and even Macdonalds, abound to the left and right of the hotel.  I think the hotel staff were more polite, obliging and responsive than those from 5* hotels which we've been to. They would give us extra pillows and blankets

Summary: Stayed in Annaheim at this wonderful hotel for 5 days. Staff were wonderful, it's very close to Disneyland and had everthing we needed. The guest laundry was a welcome surprise as we needed this facility . Would reccommend to anyone with or without children.

Summary: My family of 4 stayed at this hotel through a package deal and we got what we paid for.  Upon check in, we hopped in the very slow and slightly smelly elevator to the 3rd floor. No one was in and we entered to use the phone to call the front desk.  The front desk assigned us another room on the 4th floor.  After hauling our bags back down, then up to the 4th floor, we entered our room (418).  It was a decent size but the carpet was filthy. Summary: We stayed at the Castle Inn on a last minute trip to Disneyland. We stayed in room 425 and wer very disappointed with the condition of the room. Summary: We checked in near midnight, the process was a breeze. The room was just right and quite clean. We were out by 8am and back again by midnight so we think it is alright for bed and shower.

Summary Heading: I would return if the price is right
Summary: My family and I stayed here on our first family Disneyland trip. Considering it was the peak of the Christmas season, the service wasn't bad at all. The room was well-sized, with ample space even with the rollaway bed (which doesn't come free, BTW, so minus points for that). Housekeeping was very accommodating, and did an excellent job. They're also not stingy with towels there, a plus when you have three kids, all under the age of five. Best feature: good-sized in-room refirgerator. Worst feature: our room didn't have a bedside phone. The phone was inconveniently located on a side table close to the entrance.

Summary: Castle Inn services is Ok, towels too old ,room too old and downgrade with same dollars we can get a lot better room and service around Disney land area.we plan stay for 10days , but we have to move out after 2days.  if you like to be a king or queen in the castle it will be fine other than that  should put your money where it worth.

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for

Summary Heading: Castle Inn and Suites- A great value
Summary: My Husband and I spent the night of May 24th at the Castle Inn. We had read some horrible reviews and with great trepidition checked in.. It was only one night we would survive. Summary Heading: Loved it! Give it a go!

Summary: Staff was rude except for housekeeping who really tried to do the job with the little they had. Carpet was filthy, roaches in drawers (did not unpack our suitcases) refrigerator had mold. Summary Heading: The best: Location, rooms, management, staff

Summary: We just returned from 4 nights at the Castle Inn & Suites.  There are a lot of negative reviews and comments on Tripadvisor but for the price we thought it was ok.  It is not billed as a 5 star hotel/resort.  Yes, the bathrooms could be remodeled but we had none of the problems listed by others, just a little dated.  The room was large and had everything we needed including a big refrigerator.  The hotel has great curb appeal, very cute.  I liked the Castle Inn better than the Ramada Maingate (where we stayed during our last visit).  Give it a try, it worked well for my family.

Summary: I was apprehensive about staying here after reading some of these reviews, but I needed a 2 room suite and this hotel was one of two I found so I decided to give it a try.....and I was very happy that it turned out as well as it did! Summary: We go to Disneyland every other year and have always stayed at the Disneyland Hotel. Summary Heading: The only plus is it's close proximity to Disneyland.
Summary: We stayed at this hotel because it was walking distance to Disneyland, but that is the only thing it has going for it.  The flooring was dirty, the shower was moldy, beds were not very comfortable and the walls are very thin - we could hear the tv from the guests next door.  The small pool is in the middle of the parking lot - not very desirable.  It is a five minute walk to Disneyland, and that was nice, but the accomodations were not good.  Next time we will pay a little more and stay someplace nicer.  I could not recomment this hotel.

Summary: I stayed at the Castle Inn and Suites with my two nieces October 31, 2004 - November 5, 2004. The room was clean and had enough room for the 3 of us. I got the room for a great rate, $40, including taxes so for the price it was great, would not pay the published  rate of $89 and higher though.

Summary: I won a trip for the family and didn't have a choice where I stayed.  Our stay was on the week of September 20/04. Being my first trip ever to Disneyland I had no idea what I was getting myself into. It was fairly close to the parks but the rooms were just horrible. Summary: I guess you get what you pay for!  This hotel is close to the Disney main gates but it sure suffers from a lack of upgrading.  It is in dire need of carpet, paint, soundproofing and general maintenance.  The cleaning staff try their best to keep the place clean but it looks like it hasn't been painted in many years.  The carpets definitley need replacing as they are filthy.  Bassically don't walk around your room with white socks on they'll be black fairly quickly.  In fact the carpets have kind of a greasy feel to them.  We supposedly had a suite with a kitchenette in it.  The ktichenette consisted of a bar fridge and an old microwave.  I wouldn't recommend this as a place to stay.

Summary: After reading some of the reviews I was a bit nervous at the prospect of staying at the Castle Inn but I was pleasantly surprised! The room was nice and big and the fridge was such a  nice thing to have we stocked up on snacks and waters for Disneyland. The service was good and plenty of towels and supplies were provided. The hotel is a little older but the room we had was clean and nice the walk was a little longer than we had anticipated but nothing our kids ages 4 and 6 couldn't handle.
